intro: Betonica scardica, commonly known as greater betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Betonica scardica is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
